Name: Statuette of a scribe
Description: This fragment in granite, which was acquired in the art trade of Cairo, constitutes the upper part of a statuette of a scribe. Wearing a long wig with wavy locks, the person is dressed in a robe with pleated sleeves. On the left shoulder, he carries a scribe's palette. The inscription, written on the dorsal pillar, contains an offering formula. The piece dates from the 18th Dynasty.
